abstracts.cdata!:
The project has substantially achieved
            its objectives, by demonstrating considerable potential for
            saving electricity; project outcome is thus rated
            satisfactory with project sustainability rated likely.
            Because of adequate project preparation and supervision, the
            World Bank's overall performance is rated satisfactory.
            Borrower performance is satisfactory on balance , on the
            strength of the demand-side management (DSM) unit's
            performance, notwithstanding the lack of effective
            government support. Key lessons drawn for this project are:
            The government and the major energy sectors must foster a
            supportive policy environment through strong and proactive
            commitment. There is a potential conflict between the narrow
            goal of maximizing electricity supplies and a DSM program.
            The implementing agency must have adequate managerial and
            financial autonomy. Public awareness and promotional
            campaigns are critical. Energy efficiency audits in the
            industrial, commercial, and residential sectors need to be
            properly financed if the audit recommendation are followed
            up. Prospects for sustainability are enhanced if revolving
            fund mechanisms to recycle consumer repayments are
            incorporated n the project design and adhered to.

5080278.trustfund: TF028695-GET-DEMAND SIDE MANAGEMENT DEMONSTRATION,TF028605-GET-PPA FOR JAMAICA DSM DEMO PROJECT

repnme.cdata!:
Jamaica - Demand Side Management
            Demonstration Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The main focus of the Demand Side
            Management (DSM) Demonstration Project is on energy savings
            in the commercial sector.  Specifically, the project will:
            a) test and/or demonstrate the viability of selected energy
            savings and efficiency in the commercial sector and also
            establish the technical, economic, and financial feasibility
            of installing cogeneration capacity in the commercial
            building sector, and more specifically in hotels; b)
            implement a small pilot residential program to develop
            precise information on potential for energy savings and to
            test strategies to deliver energy efficient services in
            residential lighting, and investigate possible benefits in
            residential solar water heating; c) assess potential energy
            savings in the industrial sector and develop a strategy and
            action plan for implementation; d) develop a monitoring,
            evaluation, and quality control system to strengthen
            implementation; e) develop a monitoring, evaluation, and
            quality control system to strengthen implementation,
            performance and quality of the DSM programs and measures; f)
            strengthen the Jamaica Public Service Co. DSM unit to
            implement these DSM programs and to enhance market
            infrastructure development and public awareness for energy
            conservation by providing technical assistance and training;
            and g) strengthen other institutions such as the Jamaica
            Bureau of Standards, the Natural Resource Conservation
            Authority, and local non-governmental organizations.
